content.introduction:
Disallow specified global variables
Table of ContentsRule DetailsOptionsglobalscheckGlobalObjectglobalObjectsRelated RulesVersionResources
Disallowing usage of specific global variables can be useful if you want to allow a set of global
variables, but still want to disallow some of those.
For instance, early Internet Explorer versions exposed the current DOM event as a global variableevent, but using this variable has been considered as a bad practice for a long time. Restricting
this will make sure this variable isn’t used in browser code.
